article.title: Towards understanding the physics of collisionless relativistic shocks

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is **incorrect** regarding the reference frames used to describe the shock transition?
choices: In the shock rest frame, both the upstream and downstream plasmas are homogeneous.
In the upstream rest frame, the precursor\'s extension is larger than in the shock rest frame.
In the downstream rest frame, the shock front moves away with velocity -βd.
In the upstream rest frame, the downstream plasma moves with a relative velocity βrel.

multiple_choice_question.text: In which region of the phase diagram can Fermi acceleration occur efficiently?
What does this figure tell us about the energy gain of particles undergoing Fermi cycles?
choices: The average energy gain is constant at each Fermi cycle.
The average energy gain decreases with the number of Fermi cycles.
The maximum energy gain is achieved after numerous Fermi cycles.
Particles that escape after few cycles dominate the high-energy end of the spectrum.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary driver of the filamentation instability in the precursor of a relativistic shock?
choices: Charge separation in the beam of returning particles.
Reflection of background particles by the compressed magnetic field.
Interaction of the returning particles with the ambient magnetic field.
Growth of the electric field due to the Lorentz transform.
